segment.source: Custom logging with Field Medic
segment.target: Custom logging with Field Medic

segment.source: Custom logging with Field Medic
segment.target: Custom logging with Field Medic

segment.source: Custom logging with Field Medic
segment.target: Custom logging with Field Medic

segment.source: You can configure Field Medic to generate reports from custom loggers that are not part of the default group of loggers.
segment.target: You can configure Field Medic to generate reports from custom loggers that are not part of the default group of loggers.

segment.source: To specify a custom logger, create a profile XML file and copy it to PhoneDocumentsFieldMedicCustomProfiles.
segment.target: To specify a custom logger, create a profile XML file and copy it to PhoneDocumentsFieldMedicCustomProfiles.

segment.source: On development device, T-shell can be used to place XML files into the OEM shared folder.
segment.target: On development device, T-shell can be used to place XML files into the OEM shared folder.

segment.source: A simple package can be created to place the files there.
segment.target: A simple package can be created to place the files there.

segment.source: For more info about the structure of XML that a custom profile XML file has to contain, see Authoring Recording Profiles.
segment.target: For more info about the structure of XML that a custom profile XML file has to contain, see Authoring Recording Profiles.

segment.source: Create a custom profile XML file
segment.target: Create a custom profile XML file

segment.source: Here is an example how to create of a custom profile XML file.
segment.target: Here is an example how to create of a custom profile XML file.

segment.source: Suppose you want to create a custom category that includes these two ETW providers.
segment.target: Suppose you want to create a custom category that includes these two ETW providers.

segment.source: ETW provider name
segment.target: ETW provider name

segment.source: ETW provider GUID
segment.target: ETW provider GUID

segment.source: Microsoft-WindowsPhone-TileHelper
segment.target: Microsoft-WindowsPhone-TileHelper

segment.source: B3448AD3-4BE8-4F7C-892B-EA1D69B14ADB
segment.target: B3448AD3-4BE8-4F7C-892B-EA1D69B14ADB

segment.source: Microsoft-WindowsPhone-AccessoryManagerSvc
segment.target: Microsoft-WindowsPhone-AccessoryManagerSvc

segment.source: This custom profile XML file describes an event collector that has an ID of EventCollectorTileManager.
segment.target: This custom profile XML file describes an event collector that has an ID of EventCollectorTileManager.

segment.source: The event collector contains your two providers, which are specified in the EventProvider and EventProviderId elements.
segment.target: The event collector contains your two providers, which are specified in the EventProvider and EventProviderId elements.

segment.source: Note The ETW providers listed in the preceding XML are user-mode components.
segment.target: Note The ETW providers listed in the preceding XML are user-mode components.

segment.source: If your custom profile XML file lists a kernel-mode provider, add NonPagedMemory=”true” to the EventProvider element.
segment.target: If your custom profile XML file lists a kernel-mode provider, add NonPagedMemory=”true” to the EventProvider element.

segment.source: For more information about the structure of a custom profile XML file, see Authoring Recording Profiles.
segment.target: For more information about the structure of a custom profile XML file, see Authoring Recording Profiles.

segment.source: Add your custom profile to Field Medic
segment.target: Add your custom profile to Field Medic

segment.source: Create your custom profile XML file as described previously.
segment.target: Create your custom profile XML file as described previously.

segment.source: Copy your custom profile XML file to PhoneDocumentsFieldMedicCustomProfiles.
segment.target: Copy your custom profile XML file to PhoneDocumentsFieldMedicCustomProfiles.

segment.source: Open the FieldMedic app, and tap Advanced.
segment.target: Open the FieldMedic app, and tap Advanced.

segment.source: Tap the box under Choose which ETW providers to use.
segment.target: Tap the box under Choose which ETW providers to use.

segment.source: Scroll down to Custom Group.
segment.target: Scroll down to Custom Group.

segment.source: Under Custom Group, Field Medic displays the names of the custom profile XML files that are in PhoneDocumentsFieldMedicCustomProfiles.
segment.target: Under Custom Group, Field Medic displays the names of the custom profile XML files that are in PhoneDocumentsFieldMedicCustomProfiles.

segment.source: Select your custom profile.
segment.target: Select your custom profile.

segment.source: Generate a report as described in Use Field Medic to generate a report.
segment.target: Generate a report as described in Use Field Medic to generate a report.

segment.source: The resulting ETL files have a prefix of “Custom-“ and are placed in root of the device or the SD card.
segment.target: The resulting ETL files have a prefix of “Custom-“ and are placed in root of the device or the SD card.

segment.source: Custom profiles can be selected together, separate from, or mixed with the regular profiles depending on your logging requirements.
segment.target: Custom profiles can be selected together, separate from, or mixed with the regular profiles depending on your logging requirements.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Windows 10 Mobile has a limitation of 64 total parallel profiles, of which a variable number is always taken by the standard OS logging.
segment.target: Windows 10 Mobile has a limitation of 64 total parallel profiles, of which a variable number is always taken by the standard OS logging.

segment.source: This reserved amount depends on the type of image.
segment.target: This reserved amount depends on the type of image.

segment.source: For example, on retail phones, the reserved amount is going to be much lower than on test devices.
segment.target: For example, on retail phones, the reserved amount is going to be much lower than on test devices.

segment.source: Therefore, we recommend bundling multiple ETW providers together in a custom profile XML file if possible, or avoid selecting too many ETW providers in parallel.
segment.target: Therefore, we recommend bundling multiple ETW providers together in a custom profile XML file if possible, or avoid selecting too many ETW providers in parallel.

segment.source: If an error still occurs when running reports, try and unselect some of the profiles.
segment.target: If an error still occurs when running reports, try and unselect some of the profiles.

segment.source: Another consideration to take into account is that each running profile takes an amount of system memory away from the rest of the OS.
segment.target: Another consideration to take into account is that each running profile takes an amount of system memory away from the rest of the OS.

segment.source: So having too many parallel logging sessions may impact performance, especially on low memory devices.
segment.target: So having too many parallel logging sessions may impact performance, especially on low memory devices.

segment.source: This amount of memory can be configured in the profile XML file.
segment.target: This amount of memory can be configured in the profile XML file.

segment.source: The standard included profiles use 8 MB per XML file.
segment.target: The standard included profiles use 8 MB per XML file.

segment.source: When investigating low-memory issues, we recommend running only the profiles that are needed for that specific investigation.
segment.target: When investigating low-memory issues, we recommend running only the profiles that are needed for that specific investigation.
